newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing share market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing share market report.

text.p: Dutch shares closed lower, extending midession losses in late trade as strong U.S. durable goods orders triggered a slide in bond prices.
Trading was thin and volatile but after a choppy end to the week, shares were still up slightly on week-ago levels.
The AEX index of 25 blue chip shares closed down 4.22 points at 560.73 but above the previous week's close of 557.42.
The index hit an early high of 569.25 in an attempt to follow through on Thursday's rate-cut inspired gains, but profit-taking quickly choked the rise.
Some dealers felt the market would break its previous all-time closing high of 571.76 from June 6.
"Eventually we should be able to set new highs, though perhaps not at the first attempt, because company earnings are so strong," said one.

Others predicted further volatility with share prices, tossed to and fro depending on whether the latest economic data signalled economic strength -- and the prospect of higher interest rates -- or weakness.
One dealer said most fund managers were still trying to get a feel for market direction after the summer holidays.
"A lot of people missed the opportunity to buy when the index dipped to 510/520 in July. They missed the rally which followed and now they're scared to pay too much," he said.
Post and telecoms group Dutch PTT was one of the biggest losers on Friday, shedding 2.10 guilders at 60.60 after first-half profits at the low end of market expectations.
Net profit rose to 1.21 billion guilders from 1.11 billion while forecasts had ranged from 1.21 billion to 1.24 billion.
But food group Nutricia jumped 18 guilders to 210.00 after reporting late on Thursday a 51 percent profit rise which was boosted by its acquisition of Germany baby food firm Milupa.
